title: league of legends season 9 or season 10
body: I was just thinking in a year, or two , if we we're perma banned for not obliging too all of riot games terms and service, except for scripting, that is actually cheating, if you are reformed after realising every mistake that made you perma banned get the chance to have a second chance to lift their perma ban because in the heat of the moment, you get sick of another players play style, or feeding, get toxic, please take this into consideration rito so we can get our characters back, and if not it actual sounds like a very legitimized act to make, but too us making our 4th violation and forgetting we've made those previous statement to other players , and not learn to get the chance to learn from our scare from one of my scariest screens ive ever seen on a game EVER , but i acknowledged i deserved it, i messed up and told someone to go die and called them a fa**et  it was a mistake any feedback from rito, and share those memes give em i need a laugh, im quite depresso at the moment

replies.body:
It's great that you're making the effort to reform, and unfortunate that it took a permanent suspension to make you realise the consequences of behaviour.

The unfortunate fact is that Riot experimented with such a system, and it failed rather spectacularly. Rather than encouraging reform and continued good behaviour, the result was an almost 100% relapse rate.

It sounds like a good plan in theory, but in practice all it accomplished was undermining the stopping power the threat of permanent has. 

>making our 4th violation and forgetting we've made those previous statement to other players

This is essentially the key here. You had 3 warnings prior to your permanent suspension and none were enough to make you realise the consequences. It took the severity of a permanent suspension to make you realise that. If a permanent suspension wasn't truly permanent, would it have?

>but i acknowledged i deserved it, i messed up

And that is why (with some very specific exceptions) Riot bans accounts, and not players. That is your chance to prove you've reformed.
